body_html:
Needs a review and a merge into the main warp-ctc library, but install instructions are here. Example on how to use it is also given in the README!

I stress that if you have a pascal card you have to add a few flags into the CMakeLists.txt (god knows why it isn't merged already). Get flags here.

Finally I've been working on a deepspeech package for PyTorch. If you are interested message me and I'll add you to the repo! Still WIP and will open once it plays nice :)
body_text:
Needs a review and a merge into the main warp-ctc library, but install instructions are here. Example on how to use it is also given in the README!
I stress that if you have a pascal card you have to add a few flags into the CMakeLists.txt (god knows why it isn't merged already). Get flags here.
Finally I've been working on a deepspeech package for PyTorch. If you are interested message me and I'll add you to the repo! Still WIP and will open once it plays nice :)
body:
Needs a review and a merge into the main warp-ctc library, but install instructions are [here](https://github.com/SeanNaren/warp-ctc/tree/pytorch_bindings/pytorch_binding). Example on how to use it is also given in the README!

I stress that if you have a pascal card you have to add a few flags into the CMakeLists.txt (god knows why it isn't merged already). Get flags [here](https://github.com/baidu-research/warp-ctc/pull/48).

Finally I've been working on a deepspeech package for PyTorch. If you are interested message me and I'll add you to the repo! Still WIP and will open once it plays nice :)
